summary: Simple MOD made with permission from Maymay1588, the original author of the Ire of the Shadows armor.
descriptionHtml:
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow]This mod is no longer being kept current.  It was only made to work around the non-craftable original mod.  The original is now craftable and enchantable, so this mod is no longer required.  Please download the original mod found at the link below.[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow][/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR] 
[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26953][COLOR=#0070c0][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26953[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR][/URL]
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow][/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR] 
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow]The new patterns are craftable at the blacksmith forge, under the MISC category.  I made the crafting mats relatively simple, and I think they\'re logical based on the design of the armor.[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow][/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR] 
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow]Tempering can be done at a workbench, but costs 1 ebony ingot per piece to upgrade.  I chose to make the upgrade require rarer materials because it tends to make the set a bit OP in the armor rating area, at least by light armor standards anyway.[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow][/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR] 
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow][/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR] 
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=5][FONT=Arial Narrow]Installation/Uninstallation[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow][B]Skyrim patch 1.8 is required![/B]  [/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow]To install, first install the original MOD at the above link.  Then download and install this ESP into your data folder.  Make sure both mods are active in your load order when loading up Skyrim.[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow]To uninstall, simply delete the IOTS_Armor_extender.esp from your data folder.[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow][/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR] 
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=5][FONT=Arial Narrow]Credits[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#ffffff][SIZE=4][FONT=Arial Narrow]All credit goes to Maymay1588, for making such an awesome armor mod.  Seriously, I didn\'t design any of the visuals for this armor.  I suck at texturing/armor making.[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
author: Kpheonix57
